intro: Melandrium elisabethae, commonly known as the Elizabeth's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream sides. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Melandrium elisabethae is a short-lived perennial, often found in areas with rich, loamy soil.
